quotes.quote: Who knows whether the gods will add tomorrow to the present hour?
All human things hang on a slender thread, the strongest fall with a sudden crash.
This I ever held worse that all certitude, To know not what the worst ahead might be.
When the mind is in a state of Uncertainty the smallest impulse directs it to either side
Maturity of mind is the capacity to endure Uncertainty.
Have you heard that it was good to gain the day? I also say it is good to fall, battles are lost in the same spirit in which they are won.
If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
Everything in life is luck.
Money takes wings. The only thing that endures is character.
Doubt, of whatever kind, can be ended by action alone.
It's not a terrible thing that we feel fear when faced with the unknown. It is part of being alive, something we all share.
Madness is the result not of uncertainty but of certainty.
The trouble with the world is that the stupid are so confident while the intelligent are full of doubt.
The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
Only do what your heart tells you.
For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
Uncertainty is the only certainty there is, and knowing how to live with insecurity is the only security.
Uncertainty and mystery are energies of life. Don't let them scare you unduly, for they keep boredom at bay and spark creativity.
The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty; not knowing what comes next.
The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers.
There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
Faith means living with uncertainty - feeling your way through life, letting your heart guide you like a lantern in the dark.
One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
The quality of your life is in direct proportion to the amount of uncertainty you can comfortably deal with.
Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing, though the overtaking and possessing of a wish discovers the folly of the chase.
The longing for certainty ... is in every human mind. But certainty is generally illusion.
When one admits that nothing is certain one must, I think, also add that some things are more nearly certain than others.
If we insist on being as sure as is conceivable... we must be content to creep along the ground, and can never soar.
I can live with doubt and uncertainty. I think it's much more interesting to live not knowing than to have answers which might be wrong.
The future is uncertain  but this uncertainty is at the very heart of human creativity.
